data.text: Post 1.3: 31/03/2024 – Karl Theodor Wilhelm Weierstrass The point I am trying to drive at with my most recent, previous two, posts is that, another individual who was born on 31st of March, Karl Theodor Wilhelm Weierstrass, is someone who is much speaks much more to most of us today. Some internet sources will use the following description to/for him “he was a Gymnasium teacher without a university degree.” But if you look into his life and/or contributions, you will find that the information, could be summed up with the sentence: “His work laid the foundation for modern analysis and helped establish rigorous standards of mathematical proof.” His contributions were made in fields/areas that includes: Rigorous Definition of Limit; Theory of Functions; Mathematical Rigor; and more; So in fact, in fact, if societies think that there is only one way to do/achieve certain/most things, how many Karl Weierstrass would the world have missed? There was Darwin, there was also Wallace. There was Maxwell, there was also Faraday.
